name: S3Upload
description: Upload file and folder content to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) Bucket.
author: Amazon Web Services
helpMarkDown: Please refer to [Working with Amazon S3 Buckets](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/UsingBucket.html)

inputs.name: awsCredentials
inputs.label: AWS Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the AWS credentials to use. If needed, click on 'manage', and add a new Service Endpoint of type 'AWSCredentials'

inputs.name: bucketName
inputs.label: Bucket Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the bucket where the content will be uploaded. If the bucket does not exist it will be created.

inputs.name: sourceFolder
inputs.label: Source Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source folder that the content pattern(s) will be run against. If not set the root of the repo is assumed. Use [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) if files are not in the repo. Example: $(agent.builddirectory)

inputs.name: globExpressions
inputs.label: Filename Patterns
inputs.helpMarkDown: File path/name glob patterns to select the content to be uploaded. Supports multiple lines of minimatch patterns.

inputs.name: targetFolder
inputs.label: Target Folder (S3 Key Prefix)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The target folder (also known as key prefix) in the S3 bucket to contain the content. If not set the root of the bucket is assumed. You can use [variables](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988)

inputs.name: filesAcl
inputs.label: Access Control (ACL)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The canned Access Control List (ACL) to apply to the uploaded content. Refer to [Canned ACL](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/acl-overview.html#canned-acl)

inputs.name: createBucket
inputs.label: Create S3 bucket if it does not exist
inputs.helpMarkDown: Automatically create the S3 bucket if it does not exist.

inputs.name: overwrite
inputs.label: Overwrite
inputs.helpMarkDown: Replace existing files in and beneath the target folder.

inputs.name: flattenFolders
inputs.label: Flatten folders
inputs.helpMarkDown: Flatten the folder structure and copy all files into the specified target folder in the bucket

messages.CreatingBucket: Attempting to create bucket '%s' in region '%s'
messages.UploadingFiles: Uploading files from '%s' to '%s' in bucket '%s'
messages.HeadBucketFailed: Head operation against bucket %s failed, attempting to create
